intro: Maba nebulorum, commonly known as the cloud maba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its latex contains various compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal uses. Due to habitat loss, Maba nebulorum is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
